basics.name: Kiran Datwani
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2022.

courses: Study Abroad Program in Kobe, Japan (Spring 2020)

work.position: Assisting Teaching Assistant for Computer Science
highlights: Will start in the Fall 2021 semester

work.company: UH Mānoa Office of Student Affairs
highlights: Welcomes and prepare new students for the Fall 2021 semester
Facilitate activites to develop relationships, provide a educational experience and a sense of belonging among the students

work.company: Associated Students of the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa
work.position: Senator of the Colleges of Arts and Sciences
highlights: Representative for the UH Manoa undergraduate student body
Member of Campus Life and Undergraduate Academic Affairs committees
Represented ASUH at the ACUI Region I and IV in Reno, Nevada
Partook in monthly meetings
Student member and interview head
Interviewed and selected program heads for the 4 student-run media programs on campus
Served at special, food-related events on the university campus
Organized, prepared and served dishes at UH Manoa events
Events included Taste of Manoa, RIOs’, clubs’ and organizations’ banquets, and VIP events
Intern Reporter and Photographer
During the school semester, interned as a practicum experience, and during the summer, as a part-time job and internship
Wrote articles and stories that were published in the newspapers every week
Was a pledge, a neophyte, and finally, a sister
Served as community service co-chair in Fall 2019
Have taken part in several fundraisers, volunteered in community service events, and worked on projects beneficial for the growth of the sorority
General and Board Member
Involved in the Community service committee during the Spring semester of 2019
Board member & Public Relations co-chair during the Fall semester of 2019
Involved in the Language Exchange and Banquet committees during the Spring semester of 2021
Organized events, meetings, and activities for international and local students in the club

volunteer.organization: Parliamentary Debate World Conference and Competition (PDWC)
highlights: Team Leader, Time-keeper, and Social Media Photographer
Leader of the student ambassadors during the debate contest
Made sure the program ran smoothly and according to plan, worked alongside the manager of the event
Led and taught middle school and high school students about the US government
Learned politics separately, and taught and mentored students

awards.title: UH Mānoa International Merit Award Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa Admissions Office
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming international freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.3.

awards.title: Spring Forward Scholarship, Summer Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to continuing international students with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0.

awards.title: Spring Konan Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to a study abroad student with good grades and character.

awards.title: First Place Team
awards.summary: Student Case Study Contest in Reno, Nevada. Participated through ASUH.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Students with a 3.5 GPA or above in a semester with no grade of F or W.
